tei:attDef.tei:desc: This attribute is used to scale a dynamic gradient defined in an ornamentDef.

tei:remarks.tei:p: Typically, the scale value is non-negative. In element accentuationPattern it sets the value of the strongest accentuation. Its negative marks the strongest restraint. Setting scale to a negative value will have an inverted effet. Setting scale to 0.0 effectively deactivates any effect.

tei:exemplum.tei:p: The first ornament defines an upwards arpeggio to all notes (listed lowest to highest pitch) at date 0.0 with a scaled dynamic gradient. The second ornament applies an arpeggio to the notes listed and in the sequence of the list and specifies the sequence of notes using the noteids attribute.

tei:remarks.tei:p: The use of attribute name.ref requires the presence of an ornamentDef with the same name and within an ornament style. In the ornamentationMap there must be a style element switching to this style before the first reference to an ornamentationDef within that style.
